page.title: 16ENTERTAINMENT IN SOUTHREPPS
page.content: Entertainment is self-organised with coffee mornings, lunches, parties, concerts, plays, etc., giving three fold benefit, (1) activity during preparation, (2) enjoyment of event and (3) money raised for various projects e.g. re-pointing of Church tower (1983) (Â£42,000), Village Hall (1984) (Â£62,000) and renovation of church bells (1984/85) (Â£18,000) plus money for outside charities. Coffee mornings frequently held in homes, charging 25p. for coffee and scones, stalls and raffles provide variety. Also held are annual fetes and horti shows. Bingo and card evenings are regular features. Concerts, drama, pantomines, etc., with local talent draw audiences from many local villages. Naturally in 1985 tele- vision, videos and computers play a large role in home entertainment.
